question.title: Querying by multiple optional parameters AND date after parameters
question.body:
I'm trying to create an API in which a user can search Transactions by multiple parameters and search by transactionDate, which would be after a particular date.

Entity class:

@Entity
public class Transaction implements Serializable {
    @Id
    private Long transactionId;
    private Long accountId;
    private double accountBalance;
    private String transactionCode;
    private String state;
    private double shippingCost;
    private String product;
    private LocalDateTime transactionDate;
    //...
}

Repository class:

@Repository
public class TransactionRepository implements JpaRepository<Transaction, Long>, PagingAndSortingRepository<Transaction, Long> {
    Page<Transaction> findAllByTransactionDateAfter(LocalDateTime afterDate);
    
}

I am using the Page<Transaction> findAll(Example<Transaction> example, Pageable pageRequest) which is available via the QueryByExampleExecutor included in the JpaRepository interface. This returns results which have values having equality with the provided example.

I would like to build this out to have behavior like
Page<Transaction> findAllByTransactionDateAfter(LocalDateTime afterDate); Which returns transactions which have dates after the provided afterDate.

To accomplish this, my solution has been to filter the stream of results from the query by example like so:

results = transactions.stream().filter(transactionInfo -> transactionInfo.getTransactionDate().isAfter(afterDate)).toList;

Which I then repackage into a PageImpl. From a complexity and performance standpoint- I'd like to seek other means here.

Does query by example support querying objects which have dates before/after a date provided to the Example, or should I seek other means to perform this query.

answers.body:
You should be able to achieve your objective by just using the Naming Operators from Spring Data JPA documented here

So if you define your method name as:

Page<Transaction> findAllByTransactionDateGreaterThan(LocalDateTime afterDate);

It should work as expected.

question_comments.body: Check the documentation: docs.spring.io/spring-data/jpa/reference/repositories/… what you are looking for looks like the operator GreaterThan
